column1: full, and angling away outside off, Danushka watches it through to the keeper
even fuller, angling away, swinging away in the corridor, no shot from Danushka
good length and slanting away on a fourth-stump line, Danushka gets right behind the line and solidly defends it back to the bowler with soft hands
pretty full and outside off, Danushka presses forward, gets closer to the pitch, and drives through the line to mid-off, where the fielder (de Bryun) throws himself to his left but fumbles
Steyn shortens his length but still explores the corridor, Dimuth, however, doesn't. Left alone watchfully
Steyn hits a hard length on middle, Dimuth gets right behind it and plays it back to the bowler
opens his spell with a short ball outside off, Danushka leans back and flays it straight to backward point
back of a length and skids down the leg side, the batsman falls over the leg-side flick and does not make contact
pitched further up and angling away outside off, no shot
nice and full outside off, punchily driven off the front foot straight of mid-off
short of a length and angling away outside off, punched up to extra cover
full and angling across off, nearly 140ks, the batsman closes the face and drives weakly to mid-on
fiery lifter on leg stump, bursts off the deck to the leaping keeper as the batsman ducks under it

pitched up and angling away outside off, right up Danushka's alley, he presses forward to this full ball. He does not meet the pitch and drives uppishly but wide of the covers. Some glove love between Dimuth and Danushka
good length on off, Danushka responds with a rock-of-Gibraltar defence back to him
very full on the pads, Danushka inches forward and whisks it away to mid-on
rising short ball on middle, Danushka rides the bounce and pats it down to the leg side
full and angling away outside off, squeezed behind point off the outside edge
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, front-foot defensive
dug in short and outside off, sits up to be hit, Dimuth swivels on the back foot and laces a pull to the left of the square-leg umpire and right of long leg. Shot, Dimuth
KG responds with an angry bumper, trampolines over the ducking batsman and the leaping keeper. De Kock has a wry smile on his face
back of a length and wide outside off, no shot
banged in short and angling in from around the stumps, 142.8ks rocket, rushes Dimuth into the hook. He bottom-edges it onto his ribs. Ouch!
keeps it short and gets it to kick up outside off, hits the splice and lobs over where short leg may have been. The fielder had been pulled out earlier in the over
back of a length and on a fifth-stump line, opens the face and punches to backward point
tucked off the hips to long leg for a quiet single
good length on middle, chips a drive does Dimuth but it does not carry to Maharaj at square leg
fuller than a good length and swerving away outside off, Dimuth has a crooked poke and nicks it... it does not carry to second slip. Replays suggest it was the fast offcutter from Steyn
picked off the pads through midwicket
Danushka gets behind the line of this shortish ball on off and blocks to cover
full and on the pads, presses forward and clips it away straight to short midwicket
mighty full and outside off, jabs out a drive to mid-off
short and angling in at off from round the stumps, played back to the bowler
nice and full outside off, forward and driven up to mid-on, where Ngidi dives forward to gather the ball
there comes the bouncer, angling in at the head of Dimuth. The batsman has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking underneath it despite hanging his bat up
short and skids on off stump, 144ks, diffused to mid-on
full and outside off, closes the face and drives it beautifully through midwicket for a four. The ball trickles away to the fence, teasing the chasing fielder
full on middle, presses forward and defends to mid-off
full on middle, drives uppishly as he's early into the shot, scooped to the left of mid-on
draws the edge, but it does not carry. Good length delivery outside the off stump. He looks to defend it and gets an outside edge
defends from the middle of the bat this time. He comes forward and defends a good length ball outside the off stump

Ngidi belts out an appeal for lbw, not given by umpire Llong. Pretty full and slanting in with the angle from around the stumps, Dimuth plays around his front pad and falls over the flick but this seems to be heading down leg. Oh, the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump
lovely finish to the over from Ngidi. Good length, angling in, coaxing the batsman to play the angle. But the ball straightens away late to beat the outside edge
back of a length and angling into a front-foot defence to cover
tight line on off, Danushka opens the face and fillets the gap between covers and point
full and outside off, firmly driven down the ground, Rabada tumbles to his left to intercept the ball
back of a length and angling in at off, closes the face and forces the ball away to the left of mid-on
yowza! Lifter outside off, Danushka drops his gloves, weaves inside the line, but falls over in the end
follows the bouncer with a full ball outside off, Danushka is concentrating. He gets forward and push-drives to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, keeps a touch low, jabbed away to backward point
full and outside off, forward and toe-ends a drive to mid-off
nice and full outside off, driven through the line to the covers
tucked off the hips to long leg
full and outside off, slices a drive to the covers
back of a length and angling in at off, Danushka middles a defence back to the bowler
bouncer slanted across the corridor and he hurriedly gets out of the way to let it pass
well played. Bouncer climbs up at his chest and he rises on top of it to dab it down in front of short leg. Got a lot of glove on that
length in the corridor, tapped to point on the up
length ball rising sharply as it goes across off stump. Comfortably left alone

big lbw appeal is turned down. South Africa have reviewed it. Rabada catches the batsman on the boot in front of leg stump with a yorker. If this has pitched in line, he could be gone. But first, Ultra Edge...well the ball seems to have snuck under the toe of the bat. There's a murmur on Ultra Edge before either the ball or bat make contact with the ground. This murmur extends into a spike as the ball sneaks through from under the bat...and that is enough for TV umpire Paul Reifel to uphold the decision.
yorker just outside off, jammed into the covers
length ball just outside off, defended down the pitch solidly
leading edge flies through backward point and into the boundary. Bisects the two square fielders in that region. He's not in control, pushing well ahead of his body to try and drive this length ball
short of a length outside off, punched to short extra cover on the up
bouncer dug in too short, comfortably left alone
length ball at off stump, thuds him on the back thigh as he looks to defend

scoops it wide of mid-off. Once again, not fully in control. Full ball outside off and he goes with hard hands and no feet. Bat turns vigourously in his hands as he goes through with this but he clears short extra

outside edge falls short of the forward-diving Bavuma at point. That's three instances of the same technical mistake in an over. Ngidi drags it slightly shorter than the last ball and once again he's stabbing in front of the body
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
length ball on off stump, defended solidly from the crease
spears a length ball in at middle stump from wide of the crease. Awkward jab from the batsman, bat turns, balls ends up in the leg side
in the air but well short of mid-on. Full on middle stump, early on the flick. Ball stopped on him there

nicely timed. Allows it to come on this time instead of going at it. The best way to bat on a slow pitch. It's length, it's in the corridor, he gets behind the line and gets a nice high elbow in as he punches through extra cover
ouch! Inside edge on the pull straight into his left side. A struggle with timing again. Through the pull short early as this slants into the corridor
length in the channel, nudged into the off side
length on middle stump, some shape away from middle stump. Defended off the back foot
length at the stumps, squeezed to square leg's right off the inside half of the bat. A tight run. Maharaj makes him work for it, but he would've been just safe
length ball on off stump, defended from deep in the crease
oh nice line. Just outside off with a hint of swing away. Drawing him forward too. But Karunaratne is in the zone. Leans in and gets the bat out of the way
length ball in the corridor, defended late and into the off side
length ball on the pads, a respectful clip to square leg with soft hands
length ball into the pads, rapped on the thigh guard as he looks to flick with the angle
good length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
strays onto the pads and gets put away. Stands tall in the crease and just tickles this fine
length at off stump, defended into the off side
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
nicely played. Skips down first ball, meets it outside off and flicks it down to long-on
length ball outside off, flicked into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended off he back foot
full on off stump, flicks to deep mid-on
short of a length and into the pads. Gets back in the crease and nudges it fine
floated up outside off, met as a full toss, swept out to deep midwicket
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full and in the corridor, left alone
full at the stumps, tapped towards mid-on
yorker length outside off, jammed into the covers
length on the pads, whipped to fine leg from the crease
full on middle stump, punched firmly back towards the bowler
length and spinning in at off stump. Gets deep in the crease and caresses it into the leg side
length on off, steps out and drills it to long-on
short of a length outside off, slides on quickly as he looks to cut and it's an under-edge into the off side
length on middle stump, flicked uppishly to fine leg's right
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, can't get the back foot flick past midwicket
wide of the crease, slanted generously onto the pads at a length. Gets his weight back and nudges through midwicket
length ball in the corridor, defended off the back foot
short and on the hips. Tapped to fine leg...who is really close in. But can't stop the single
length on off stump, blocked into the off side
length, attacking the stumps. Solidly defended
length outside off and a mistimed drive to mid-off off the front foot
length ball on off, defended on the front foot
length outside off, swepts nicely along the floor to deep square
length on off, walks across and flicks to backward square
length outside off, spinning in and jumping as he presses forward to defend and gets an inside edge
length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
overpitched outside off, leans into the drive but can't beat extra cover
length in the corridor, poked into the covers
inside edge as he hangs the bat outside off. Length ball going across the stumps and he plays away from the body
short of a length and slanted across the corridor, left alone
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length outside off, plonks a big stride across and sweeps to deep square's left
short and wide outside off, spinning in a long way. Chopped to mid-off's right off the back foot
length ball on middle stump, pushed flat. Defended off the back foot
flat, back of a length at the stumps. Blocked off the back foot
length on leg stump, nudged to backward square's right with soft hands
bouncer rising sharply outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot. That was an offcutter.
short ball at the chest, defended into the pitch with soft hands
length on middle stump, mistimed drive to mid-on on the up
well left. This shapes in a touch into the corridor before leaving him off a length on the pitch. Stays clear of attempting to play
length ball on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the front foot
length on middle stump, nudged into the leg side off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine's right. Bavuma is in there now, they won't chance the single
length on middle stump, thick inside edge as he presses forward. But there's no short leg t take that
leading edge but safe. He looks to flick from outside off and closes the face early
short of a length outside off, spins away in the corridor, tapped into the cover
tossed up at off stump, driven back to the bowler
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
nearly hits straight into short extra's hands. Short ball outside off. Shapes to cut and his weight moves backwards too early as the ball stops on him. Checks his shot and it lands short
length outside off, pushed to mid-off's right...and they get an overthrow at the striker's end
beaten. Well bowled. Drifts it in at a length outside off and gets it to rip past the outside edge
length on leg stump, carefully poked into the leg side off the front foot
length on middle, dead-batted into the pitch
full outside off, pushed wide of mid-off off the front foot
length on middle stump, jumps down and flicks neatly to deep midwicket
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the back foot
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked into the covers with the turn
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
yorker length at the stumps. Jabbed down to long-on
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, met on the full, but can't drive firmly enough to beat Amla at mid-off
another full toss on off stump, driven down the long-off
full outside off, leans in and pushes wide of mid-off
length outside off, pings off the inside edge as he looks to defend
length on leg stump, steps out and flicks to midwicket
sweeps and gets it to the fine leg fence off the under-edge. Didn't get close to this length ball on leg stump and was swiping hard
length on leg stump, nudged to square leg off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
length outside off, pushed to cover's right. Can't beat him
slapped to long-off's right. Short ball pushed very wide outside off. Cuts hard to bisect short extra cover and cover
short of a length outside off, pushed to cover with the turn
length ball spinning away sharply outside off, left alone
full on off stump, driven with the turn to short extra
full outside off, driven straight to cover
tossed on the pads, nurdled to short midwicket off the front foot
drifting into the pads again, defensively tapped past the left of forward short leg
looped up on middle, not much turn, the batsman presses forward and plays it back to Maharaj
spinning into the pads, nudged away to short fine leg
breaking into the pads again, too full, duly tickled away fine of short fine leg for four. The partnership is worth 97 runs
tossed up down the leg side, deflected off the pads to short fine leg as he does not make requisite contact with the sweep
rides the bounce of a short one outside off and glides it off the face to gully
variable bounce! Back of a length and scoots low on off, skids off the pitch, the batsman hastily jams his bat down and defends it to the leg side
tucked off the hips to Maharaj at long leg
lifter, aimed the ribs, Dimuth fends at it and cops a nasty blow on his top glove as the ball rolls away to cover
back of a length and on the leg stump, nudged away to square leg off the back foot
back of a length on middle, Danushka jumps across off stump and blocks it back down the pitch
floated up outside off, down the track and whipped with the wrists to midwicket, where there's a fumble
full and outside off, driven to the right of mid-off. And that's SL's first century opening stand since October 2016 - and first at home since 2010
back of a length on the hips, tucked around the corner
glanced off the pads through backward square leg
Dimuth steps out, adjusts to the sharp dip, and pokes it away towards mid-on
here comes Dimuth: down the track and laced to long-on for one
Dimuth gets on top of a short ball outside off, opens the face, and suuuweetly punches it behind point. He raises his bat and acknowledges his 16th Test fifty. Well done, Dimuth
full on the pads, nurdled to fine leg. And that's Danushka's maiden Test fifty
back of a length on off, stabbed away to mid-on off the back foot
rides the bounce of a short ball outside off and swivel-pulls to long leg
short on leg stump, the batsman swats it away to fine leg like a fly
darted onto the pads, picked off to square leg
turning down the leg side, tickled away through square leg
clipped off the pads to square leg
full on middle, defended to short leg
shuffles across and works it defensively to short leg
full on middle, bunted away to midwicket
tossed on middle, there's nobody at point, so Dimuth rolls out a reverse-sweep. He top-edges it in the air but it's safe. Dimuth searches for two, there's a mix-up. Eventually, it's safe for SL
back of a length on off, Dimuth tips forward and middles a defence to cover
full and straight, forward and whipped to square leg
full on the stumps, clipped away between midwicket and mid-on
slower cutter on the pads, the batsman delays his flick and chips to square leg
nice and full outside off, eased to mid-off off the front foot
bouncer on off, rushes the batsman into a hook and draws a top edge that flies over the keeper for four
glanced through square leg
down the track and toe-ends a drive to mid-off

Dimuth has been strangled down the leg side. De Kock swiftly moves to his right and snags the catch. Umpire Llong raises his finger to send Dimuth back for 53. Tossed up, full, starts on leg stump and spins down the leg side. Dimuth can't get enough bat on the flick and tickles it behind to the keeper. Smart catch from de Kock behind the stumps. Some respite for SA after a wicket-less morning session
full on middle, dead-batted away
full on middle, defended off the front foot
low-arm slider, de Silva hurriedly jams it out
good length and angling across off, no shot
fuller on off, clipped to short midwicket
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
fast offcutter, sticks in the pitch, this length ball is bunted down towards mid-off
rides the bounce of a short ball outside off and diffuses to gully
short on the hips, tucked away through square leg
tossed up, breaks in from outside off, dips sharply, down the track and inside-edged onto the pad
more sharp turn for Maharaj, blocked away to the leg side

Oh my, Rabada has pulled off a blinding catch. He tears in from deep square leg, tumbles forward, and takes a ripper of a catch with both hands. Just like that, the two openers have been dismissed in two overs. Maharaj dangles it up just outside off, turns in, Dimuth dares to slog-sweep it away. He, instead, top-edges a catch. That it was a catch was down to Rabada's brilliance
full and drifts in at off stump, forward and played back
on a length and turns away outside off, stabbed to the covers
lobbed up outside off, hint of turn, Mendis stretches out for a sweep and only collects fresh air
back of a length and outside off, stabbed away to the left of the bowler
fullish and angling into a solid little punch to mid-on
back of a length and slanting in at off stump, de Silva keeps back and blocks to the leg side
dug short and outside off, de Silva aims for a short-arm pull. Instead, he short-arm flaps it to short midwicket
looks like a slower offcutter on middle, defended to the leg side
shot, Dhananjaya. He gets on top of a short ball that holds its line outside off and punches it crisply through the covers. The ball purrs away to the fence
top-quality ball from Maharaj. Drifts in on off, dips, then turns away past the outside edge
full on middle, Mendis stretches out and sends it clattering away to the square leg boundary with a rasping slog-sweep
pushed through on middle and leg, Mendis rolls out another sweep and fetches back-to-back boundaries. This is cracked to the midwicket fence
dangled up on off, defended
punched off the back foot to the covers
swept away again, this time there's a man at deep square leg to collect it
just short of a good length and outside off, Mendis punches it strongly to covers
full and holds its line outside off, Mendis stretches out and drives to covers
full and holds its line outside off, left alone in the corridor
back of a length and straightens outside off, tapped to the covers
back of a length and outside off, stabbed to point
good length and nibbles through outside off, no shot
darted short and wide outside off, lashed off the back foot to short cover
full on leg stump, slugged away to the square leg fence. This time de Silva rolls out the flat, hard sweep
tossed on off, dead-batted
fired on off stump, dead-batted to the leg side
looped up on middle, blocked back off the front foot

full and sliding into the right-hander, who skips down the track but is too close to the pitch and ends up wearing it on the pad. Not given lbw; the batsman was so far down the pitch, and SA decide against a review
back of a length and slanting in at off, shuffles across and dabs the ball towards short midwicket
bouncer on middle, Mendis ducks under it
on a length on a fifth-sixth stump line, Mendis lets the ball slide off the face to backward point
shuffles across and clips a single to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, swatted across the line to deep midwicket
just short of a good length and outside off, Mendis stays beside the line and forces the ball to the covers
short and turning away wide outside off. Makes too much room for the cut, gets it to cover
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
raps the pad with an arm ball, but this has pitched on middle and is sliding down as the batsman looks to defend on the front foot
nutmegs short leg with a flick. Full ball on leg stump and the flick is too quick for the fielder to take the catch
length on middle, nudged back down the pitch
tossed up at middle, blocked nicely on the front foot
short ball rising away outside off. Gets on his toes and dabs it into the covers
full on off stump, check-punch to mid-off and they steal a single from Steyn
length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
bouncer above his left shoulder and he thinks of the hook. Just enough time in the pitch for him to change his mind and allow it to pass
bouncer at the chest, a controlled hook with a swivel, out to deep square
beaten. Rabada gets one to straighten. A hint or reverse before. Draws him forward in the corridor and zips past the outside edge
lobs to short leg after he steps out and is forced to block with his front pad
length at the stumps, nudged into the leg side
full on middle stump, tapped to extra cover
length outside off, defended into the off side
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
loopy length ball at off stump, slight turn away, but expertly defended on the front foot with soft hands
nearly defends it onto the stumps. Rabada hurries one in back rapidly and cramps him on the back foot defence. Luckily for him, his back leg gets in the way as he jams this into the turf
short of a length at the hips, gets deep and hurriedly flicks to deep square
bouncer just outside off, withdraws from the hook
close. The bat comes down really late as this inswinger hoops in towards middle stump from a good length. He just manages to block it, feet were rooted
quick bouncer, has him ducking hurriedly
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
beautiful. Graceful. Steps out, curves his hips to get leg side of it as he reaches the pitch and use his hands nicely to rise with the ball, with the turn, and drill it straight over the bowler
length on off stump, gets down and sweeps along the floor to deep square
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended into the off side off the outside half
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, dead-batted into the leg side
bouncer headed down leg side. Anxiously prods at it at rib-height, but he can't get bat on it
bouncer a little too short to bother him, gets under it easily
short ball on off stump, leaps off the pitch and defends solidly
full outside off, pushed to mid-off off the toe-end
shot. But it won't beat mid-off.  Length outside off and he gets his weight nicely into this drive, with a full face
thick edge, no gully, four runs. Gets one to straighten and has him defending inside the line at a corridor length ball. But it's done deftly and it's rewarded well
poor ball. Tired ball. It's been a long-ish spell. Short and wide and spanked away off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked into the leg side off the front foot

that Mendis sweep. We will never know for sure if it's a weakness or a strength. For now, it's his undoing. A very ordinary end after settling in nicely. Maharaj hangs this up outside off and gets it to dip on a good length. Mendis has extended the front leg for the sweep but it appears he has got his head up a tad too soon. He's lost some balance as a result, and all his timing. This floats up off the bottom edge of the bat and Rabada runs across into the midwicket region from backward square to hold on
tossed up at middle stump, blocked off the front foot
leading edge as he gets on the back foot and looks to whip through mid-on, against the turn
length, drifting in at off, spinning away sharply. He leaves it alone
short of a length on a sixth stump line. Some shape in. Left alone
short of a length outside off, tapped to mid-off from the crease
length on middle stump, anxiously poked into the midwicket region
length outside off, nervous half-stride as he defends away from the body
length ball outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, stretches away from the body again as he defends
short of a length and spinning away from middle stump. Backs away and whips to mid-on against the turn
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
slider and he shuffles hurriedly in the crease to defend off the back foot. It was keeping low
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
keeps it out. Barely. Arm ball ripping in again and once more, his stumps are exposed as he backs away
length ball angled in at off stump, defended off the back foot
well, now he looks at the pitch but this one's one him. Lands a bounce a few yards ahead of his own stride and it rises, then it dips, and then De Kock takes it on the bounce.
length outside off, blocked into the covers on the front foot
length ball into the hips, clipped to deep square
poor bat. This flowing cover drive at a full ball outside off is met with the toe-end
nudges it wide of mid-on to get off the mark. Creates an awkward angle for Mathews, goes wide of the crease. Mathews' head falls over and there's a big gap between bat and pad as he flicks
short of a length outside off, stabbing away from the body, getting it down the pitch
length outside off, uses the turn to steer it through backward point
full on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
floated up at a length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
arm ball at off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
whack. Short and wide. Mathews nicely in position to dispatch this. Cuts to the point boundary
full on leg stump, dead-batted into the pitch
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball curving in at off stump. Punched to mid-off who fires a throw in at the non-striker's and gives away an overthrow through square leg

outside edge will get him to 5,000 Test runs. Mathews may not be at his best, but he is one of their best. Chucks his hands at this full ball outside off, a thick edge trickles through the gully region
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
beaten. Looks to defend outside off but this straightens after angling in
length ball wide outside off, left alone
looped up outside off, presses forward and push-drives the ball to the covers
tossed up and angling into the pads, patted away to the leg side

Wicket no. 4 for Maharaj. Excellent delivery: tossed up, drifts in at off stump, forcing Mathews to play. Then breaks away and bounces to graze the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat as Mathews prods at it. Faf snaffles it at first slip, diving across low to his right
flighted on off, a front-foot defence ensues
angling in and turns away outside off from a length, jabbed away to the covers
Roshen opens the face and drives a non-turning full ball from outside off to the covers
full inswinger, on off stump, forward and punched up to mid-on
back of a length and skids through outside off, stabbed away from the body to mid-off
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick to midwicket
on a length and holds its line outside off, a back-foot drive to the covers ensues
just short of a good length and outside off, punched on the up to the covers
good length on off, defended back
slow turn for Maharaj, finds the outside edge but dies and rolls away to the right of Faf at first slip. Credit to Roshen for employing soft hands
dangled up on middle, dead-batted away
full on middle and leg, driven past the right of mid-on
short and darted in, this arm ball is cracked through the line to long-off
picked off the pads to square leg's right
run away past silly point with soft hands for one
good length and slanting in at off stump, Roshen replies with a front-foot defence
full on off, opens the face and drives to the covers
back of a length and wobbling through the corridor, ignored
good length and outside off, ignored again
on a length and outside off, prods at it, a thick outside edge threads the cordon for four
back of a length and outside off, forced to backward point
floated up outside off, grips and turns away, no shot
full on middle, worked away through the vacant spaces at square leg
marches down the track, meets a full-toss, and whips to square leg, where there's a fumble
full, drifts in, dips on middle, opens the face and guides it to the covers
short and spins away outside off, the length is wrong, and he gets punished. Roshen rocks back and cuts it firmly through cover point
tossed on off, tapped to the covers
back of a length and outside off, leans back and punches handsomely through the gap at the covers
short on off, Dhananjaya gets behind the line in defence
on a length and outside off, stabbed to mid-off
banged in short and outside off, Dhananjaya takes it on and pulls it between the two short midwickets for four
back of a length on middle, glanced to long leg
full and outside off, blocked
tossed up and spins away outside off, ignored
dangled up on off, blocked off the front foot
shorter and spins away outside off, goes on the back foot and jabs it away to the covers

clipped with the incoming angle to deep square leg as SL bring up 200
back of a length and angling into a rock-solid defence

dipping full-toss, the batsman falls over the flick, but this inswinger is going down the leg side
follows it with a chest-hunting short ball, fended off
flicks a full ball from off to mid-on, where Steyn fumbles. Sloppy stuff
back of a length and cuts away against the angle to beat the outside edge as the batsman hangs his bat out in the corridor

lovely ball, drifts in just a shade outside off and turns away to beat the outside edge
short and outside off, slapped through the covers

short and angling into the ribs, 134ks, Dhananjaya expected it to bounce further. He ducks into it and cops a nasty blow. He clutches his shoulder and grimaces in pain. Dhananjaya needs medical attention. And that's drinks at SSC
length at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
short ball at off stump, defended off the back foot
inswinging yorker speared in at off stump. Jabbed out to point
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
short ball outside off, pulled into the ground, on the bounce to midwicket
painfully slow short of a length ball at off stump. Gets on the back foot and whips through midwicket

short and wide outside off, punched firmly at extra cover
full on off stump, steps out and drives to the bowler
short and very wide. Chopped through point. Rabada puts in a sprint and dive to his left from sweeper cover, but he won't keep that in. It's fifty for Dhananjaya
insiwnging yorker at off stump, jammed into the covers

length on off stump, blocked from the crease
bouncer headed for his front shoulder. Ducks under it
well left. This short ball is dipping at his chest and he stands his ground as he arches backwards to let it go

got him! A Rabada yorker will sneak through you eventually. Roshen has been keeping his stride from locking his bat all this while, but falters a touch as Rabada goes for leg stump. Front leg is planted across and there isn't room for the bat to come down
short of a length on leg stump, backs away and punches to long-on
short and wide outside off, follows with his hands and taps to backward point
short of a length outside off, punched to point's left
bat as he goes deep and nearly misses at quicker one in front of the stumps. It rolls into the pitch off his boot
short of a length and down leg side. Allows it to come on and tickles it fine
length on middle stump, glanced to square leg off the back foot
short ball at the chest, pulled uppishly to deep square, but there isn't enough strength for that to carry
yorker outside off, dug out into the covers
edge past slip. Squares him up with the angle, getting the outside edge as this jags away off the surface. To his credit, Dickwella was playing close to his body
length and in at middle stump, tapped into the leg side
full on leg stump, driven to midwicket
another ball that cuts away off the pitch. This one draws him forward and away from his body. He follows with his hands and defends
short and wide outside off, backs away and laps this past first slip
length at middle stump, back in the crease to turn this to square leg
inside edge lands well in front of short leg. Tossed up wide outside off and he shuffles but won't put a big stride in against the turning ball as he defends

there it is, the sweep. He's gloved a rising length ball in trying to fetch it from way outside off. Stumps exposed, body inside the line. It was predictable. Lobs up for first slip and it's an easy catch to bring up Maharaj's fifth five-wicket haul.
dangled up on off stump, presses forward and drives to mid-off
here comes Dilruwan: dashes down the track, meets the pitch of a tossed-up ball and launches it down the ground. Such a clean hit
good length and angling into the pads, tickled away to fine leg
very full and skidding into off stump, shoots low, jammed out
inswinging yorker, tails in at off, squirted out
short and wide outside off, stabbed off the back foot through the covers
full and outside off, ignored
back of a length and slanting in at off, glided behind point
short of a length and skidding on outside off. Chops to deep point

lbw appeal has been turned down and South Africa have reviewed. A slider from Maharaj traps him on the front foot in front of middle. There was angle in, did it straighten enough? There's no bat on this, height looks good. Oh it's smashing leg stump. It looked that plumb, to be fair. And it is. Maharaj is turning it on. This is a potential collapse from here.
lovely shot. Big stride to meet it on the pitch outside off and a drill through cover
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
inside edge as he goes with hard hands to defend this. Spinning in and climbing at a length on off stump
length on off, defended off the back foot
length outside off, defended into the off side
yorker on leg stump, jammed into the leg side
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball outisde off. Uppish cut falls short of backward point
short outside off and he keeps the cut on the ground this time. Dale Steyn slides to his left there to stop one-handed. Parries it for the slip fielder and gets a burn on his elbow in the bargain
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
nice! Won't let him bowl at him. Length ball is wide outside off and allows him room to swing from under after he steps out
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

driven straight to cover. Floater outside off and it's struck well but straight to the only man there.
beats point this time. Full control. Short of a length ball outside off and he merely opens the face to guide it to the third man boundary
short of a length on off, defended off the back foot

short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot

beaten on the cut. Too much bounce off the surface for him to connect

short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to cover
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
full on off stump, tapped to extra cover
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
good length outside off, blocked on the front foot

finds backward square. That's a bit...soft. It's a full ball down leg side. He sweeps vigourously but it has gone flat and straight to the fielder there. Maharaj is now the only visiting bowler other than Yasir Shah to take seven wickets in Sri Lanka
length on middle stump, pushed uppishly into the leg side where...they don't have a short leg...
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the front fot

what a catch! Markram flies to his left at short extra and holds on, one-handed! He's static there and it takes some effort to get off the floor. Lakmal is beaten in flight outside off. Looks to drive but it's uppish. Stunning catch.
length outside off, bloked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked off the back foot
short and wide, cut to deep point
yorket length at off stump. Jammed into the turf
nearly hits off stump. Tossed up outside off and he swings across the line, only to miss
short of a length outside off, cut to deep point

heaves it to the deep midwicket region. Steps out and is beaten in flight outside off
length on middle stump, blocked into the leg side
length ball down leg side, steers it to fine leg
short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot

short and wide, cut through cover

short and wide, cut to deep point
beaten. Length ball outside off, looks to defend but the stride isn't enough to cover the turn on this
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
QDK plucks it out of the air as this ball explodes off the pitch. Short of a length, big puff of soil as it lands and spins sharply away outside off
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and spinning in at middle stump. Gets on the back foot and tickles it to deep square

full on middle stump, leans in and defends down the pitch

spits up as Herath looks to get forward to this length ball outside off. Flies past the outside edge

bouncer on a middle stump line. Ducks under it

similar length and angling across off, waft and a miss in the corridor

shorter and spins back in, tickled off the pads to short fine leg
Rabada nails an off-stump yorker, dug back to the bowler
Not quite the reverse-swat, but it's fun when Herath unleashes a big swing. Back of a length and outside off, Herath throws his bat at the ball and smears it over backward point
back of a length, thigh-high ball outside off, Herath has a leg-side slog at it... and only collects thin air
short at the ribs, short-armed away to fine leg
another off-stump yorker, jammed out to backward point
bouncer, angling away outside off, Akila sinks under it

C'mon Rangana, swing it away like a boss. Just short of a good length and outside off, he stands tall and whacks it up and over midwicket

back of a length on off, sticks in the pitch and shakes up Rangana. He chips a drive to the left of the bowler

dropped. More a missed chance actually. And he may have hurt himself as well. Drilled extremely hard straight back at him, pings the left shin as he gets down to try and get his hands around it

reverse sweep, comes on too straight and lobs up off the glove straight over the keeper

pushed to the vacant space in cover for a quick single

dispatched disdainfully. A harmless back of a length delivery that Herath swats away through midwicket
even shorter, and played with even more authority. Clears the front leg and pummels it to between deep midwicket and deep square leg
short of a length on the pads, tucked to deep backward square leg
short again, these are sentences I never thought I'd type a few years ago.. Herath taking on Steyn! Short, angling away giving him all the room he needs to slap it over mid-on
bangs it furiously into the surface in response and Herath easily gets under it
short ball down the leg side, Herath avoids it
spins in from a short of a length and cuts it late through backward point. Every run is hurting SA

length on middle, shuffles and blocks

shortish and rises on off, Herath rides the bounce and punches it behind point to third man

rides the bounce of another short ball on off and swats it away to long leg like a fly. 'With a faint glimmer of the Jayasuriya swagger, immediately after the ball is struck,' as Fidel Fernando writes (like only he can) in this blockbuster TCM profile
banged in short on off, fended off
Steyn hits the deck harder as this bouncer flies to the keeper. Akila ducks under it safely. The wait continues...

Herath has been given out caught behind by Umpire Llong. He immediately challenges the on-field out decision. This was full and pushed through on the leg stump, Herath drops down to one knee and attempts a sweep. He only tickles it off the glove to Elgar at leg stump. The stubborn last-wicket stand is over and SL are dismissed for 338
slides on with the arm, blocked on off stump off the front foot
turn and bounce for Dilruwan with the new ball. Starts outside off and breaks back in to catch the thigh pad
pitched up and outside off, sliced away behind point, to third man
full on middle from around the stumps, jammed out
this full arm ball is squeezed away to short leg's right

lobs a full-toss outside off, skewed away wide of short midwicket off the inside half. That should've been carted to the fence

Caught Dananjaya bowled Dananjaya. Outstanding catch at second slip. Akila drifts one in from around the wicket and then gets it to break away outside off. Elgar presses forward, but the ball dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch of the ball. It spins away to square the batsman up and find the edge. The other Dananjaya - de Silva - tumbles forward in the cordon to snag the ball even as it was dying on him.
arm ball, slides in on off, blocked from the crease
flighted on off stump, shuffles across a bit and defends to short leg

ventures across off and sees out a tossed-up offbreak that finishes on middle
flatter and fired on off stump, watchfully blocked to the covers

pushed through much fuller outside off, de Bryun employs his reach to good effect and drives through the line, through the covers, for three
flat on middle and leg, worked away to square leg
lobbed up on middle, swatted away... but short leg is in the way and stops the ball
flighted on off, bends forward in defence

Two in two overs for Dananjaya. Nicked off. This was the straighter one outside off from Dananjaya, de Bruyn searches for turn and plays inside the line of it. The outside edge is found. This is the challenge for the visiting batsmen in the subcontinent. Which one will turn? Which will not? Which will go on with the natural variation? Keep scratching your heads
full on off, Amla shuffles forward and across in defence
fired just a shade outside off, jabbed through the covers

pushed through on middle, defended from the crease

sharp turn and bounce from outside off, but does not threaten off, left alone
full and spins in from wide of the crease, inside-edged onto the front pad

drifts in on leg stump, defended back. 'Good bowling Rangaiyya,' is the cry from behind the stumps

skids on off stump, jabbed to the covers from the crease
full on middle, presses forward and defends the ball to short leg

good length and breaks back in to beat the inside edge and lob to leg gully off the thigh pad

flat and attacking the stumps, blocked away now

short and spins away wide outside off, Roshen leans back and cuts crisply, finding the gap behind point. Laced away
slid through outside off, driven through the line to the left of sweeper cover
short and banged down the leg side, de Kock throws himself to his left to half-stop the ball. Given as a bye
short and holds its line outside off, jabbed away to slip
back of a length and outside off, no shot
good length and skidding into leg stump, Ngidi has the batsman falling over the flick but this is surely swinging down the leg side. Rabada's getting some reverse
back of a length and bending in to hit the thigh pad, beating the inside edge. Skipping down leg once again
bouncer, angling in from wide of the crease, Roshen has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
looped up on middle, turned away through the vacant spaces at square leg
slower through the air and angling in, dead-batted
tossed wider outside off, driven with an open face to sweeper
full on middle, prodded to backward point
flighted on off, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up and turns away outside off, pokes an outside edge past lone slip
good length and holds its line on off, presses forward and defends
pitched up and reversing in at off stump, wafted to midwicket off an inside edge
on a length and outside off, Roshen jabs away from the body and gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad
full and Steyn explores the corridor, Roshen, however, doesn't
bouncer outside off, raises a puff of dust from the pitch, Roshen sways his upper body out of the way
full on off, opens the face and pokes it out to the covers
Mathews leans back and slaps a short through the point region. Backward point swoops down to his right but Roshen is well in, completing the single
back of a length, curves in, then spins away outside off, punched off the back foot but can't get it past backward point
lobbed up on off, Mathews stretches out and smothers it
Maharaj shortens his length a bit and gets it to turn away past the outside edge. Mathews did well to tuck his bat inside the line
full and dips on middle, edged to the covers
good length and drifts in on off, opens the face and runs the ball past the close-in fielders
good length and angling into a gentle little flick to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, steers it off the face to the covers
on a length and outside off, stabbed square through the off side
good length and outside off, ignored
Roshen rides the bounce of this lifter and drops it down to the off side
short and darted down leg, Steyn hits 140ks, finally
dragged down outside off, Mathews laces a cut to sweeper off the back foot
tossed on off, run away past second slip to third man
good length and curves in on off stump, played back to the bowler off the back foot
low full-toss on the leg stump, another tired delivery from Maharaj. A twirl of the wrists sends the ball to the midwicket fence
pitches outside leg and turns, Mathews kicks it away with his pad
floated up on the leg stump, Angelo Mathews tips it through square leg and raises a fifty. The lead is 444 now
back of a length and angling into off stump, played back to the bowler
good length and angling into off stump, played back to Steyn
good length and keeps low on off, stabbed back to the bowler
on a length on off, punched back down the pitch
very full on middle stump, chipped in the air to the right of the squarer of the twin short midwickets
glanced off the pads to the right of deep square leg
darted short and outside off, Mathews cuts but the ball fizzes through to the keeper
shorter and outside off, cracked away to sweeper from the back foot
drifts in and breaks away outside off, extra bounce to boot, the batsman tucks his bat inside the line
tossed up and drifts in on off, defended back to Maharaj
fuller than a good length, turns and bounces in the corridor. Roshen plays inside the line and allows himself to be beaten
Maharaj shortens his length, slapped through the off side
short at the ribs, fended off behind square on the leg side
on a length and just a shade outside off, forced back down the pitch
pitched up and outside off, eased to deepish mid-off off the front foot
short and angling across off, Roshen arches back but does not get bat on the ramp to third man
back of a length and slanted down leg, no shot
lifter on leg stump from around the wicket, 131ks, Roshen ducks under it and troops off for lunch with Mathews
tossed up and curves in at off stump, Mathews bends forward in defence
shorter and spins away outside off, Mathews reaches out for the ball with his hands and forces it square through the off side to the left of silly point
floated on the pads, turned away to midwicket
looped up on middle, Mathews bends forward in defence once again
very full and drifts in at off, Mathews takes a step out and drills it back to Maharaj
full on the stumps, Mathews eases a single down the ground to round out the over
picked off the pads to the squarer of the twin short midwickets
back of a length and slanting into an inside-edged push to short midwicket on middle
short and on a fourth-stump line, Mathews gets on top of it and plays a jabbing punch up to mid-off
slower cutter outside off, Mathews does not read the change-up and therefore is early into the cover drive. He winds up chipping it wide of the fielder
back of a length and angling into off stump, Rabada has Mathews hopping and fending it back to him
full and angling into a leg-side flick to the straighter of the two short midwickets
shorter and spins away outside off, the extra bounce takes it over the top edge
fuller and flatter on off, jammed out
Roshen does well not to follow the ball. Plays inside the line of this turning ball and lets it explode to de Kock
Roshen steps out, adjusts, and jabs this well-flighted delivery to short cover
straighter one from Maharaj, this full ball has the batsman playing around his pads, but this heading down leg
darted straight on middle, Roshen brings his bat down hastily and keeps it out
slower ball on the hips, glanced away behind square on the leg side
short and slanting into a leg-side flick to square leg
tailing into the pads, draws another flick, straight to square leg
floated full and outside off, Roshen does not pick the slower offcutter and inside-edges a drive to short midwicket
Ngidi bangs a bouncer on off stump, Roshen watches it carefully before sinking under it
Roshen meets this shortish ball with an open face and steers it from outside off to backward point
short and wide outside off, Mathews flails at that and sends the ball to the point boundary. He continues to fill his boots
pushed through just a shade outside off, forward and patted into the covers with soft hands
turn and bounce outside off, Mathews stabs at it but the ball skirts past the outside edge
fired full on middle, squeezed away through the midwicket region
drifts in at off, Roshen angles his bat and dabs it to gully
drifts in slower at off stump and breaks away past the outside edge. Roshen did well not to follow the ball. He simply plays inside the line and allows himself to get beaten
back of a length and angling in at off, played back to the bowler
yorker, tails in on middle and leg, dug out to short midwicket
short and on middle, tucked away past the twin short midwickets through the square-leg region
Roshen stays beside the line of this short ball outside off and stabs it away to the covers

good length and holds its line outside off, Roshen simply watches it through to the keeper
flat and turns away outside off, Mathews shifts his balance onto back foot and punches to point
shorter and spins away outside off, Mathews skips back again and lashes it away to the right of backward point. You Can't get it past Temba's dive
pushed through on the stumps, kept out

pushed through on middle, forward-defensive from Mathews
tossed on off, forward and bunted into the covers
hard-spun offbreak, turns, bounces, jammed to the off side off the back foot
more sharp turn and bounce for Markram, lobbed in the air, the ball bursts out of short leg's hands. De Bruyn had very little time to react and close his hands around the ball
full on middle, defended
darted short and outside off, chopped to deep third man
back of a length and breaks outside leg, directed behind square leg and that brings up the fifty stand between Mathews and Roshen
Roshen presses forward, and whips this full one from outside off to the right of midwicket
drifts in and turns away outside off as Roshen plays inside the line of this ball

loopy and turns away outside off, Roshen plays and misses again
reaches out and chips a drive to sweeper cover does Roshen

dropped again. Theunis de Bruyn at short leg can't get his hands on this glance. It's headed low and into his leg, but the fielder is up early

tossed up outside off, steps out and drives with the turn to extra cover

slow motion lunge to the right from Faf Du Plessis at first slip to hold on to this. Length ball dipping and turning away slowly outside off. He chases with his hands, no front foot stride and it's a nice little edge that carries at about knee height to South Africa's captain. In a tribute to this match, he labours downwards and stays on the ground after catching
on a length and spins back in from outside off, Dickwella lets it pass

short and outside off, leans back and crunches it to sweeper cover

breaking into the pads, tickled away fine of short fine leg. The fielder chases hard and slides to haul the ball into play

pushed through on middle, driven away straight of mid-on for one

drilled through the line to mid-off

Oh wait, the umpires are checking for a possible no-ball. Tight, tight call. Looks like the foot is on the line. Nothing behind the line, according to me. But I guess the benefit of the doubt will go to the bowler. Nope, it's been called a front-foot no-ball. A not-so-happy birthday for Dilruwan
good length and on off stump, defended off the back foot
drifting into the pads, kept out

arm ball on middle, defended

skids in on middle, draws an inside edge but does not carry to short leg
back of a length and spins away, prodded past slip

nimble footwork from Markram. He races down the track, takes it on a half-volley and smears it straight of mid-off for four
short and spins in on middle, back-foot force to midwicket

fuller on off, defended

this spins away outside off, he plays inside the line and lets it go
fizzing arm ball, rushes the batsman. Inside-edged onto the pad

Clipping only the outside of off stump. The ball rolls away fine. Four leg byes

another straighter one that pins the pad. Sangappeal from Dickwella. SL choose to review back-to-back not-out decisions. Good length and straightens on off to beat the outside edge and ping the back thigh. No bat involved again. This also returns umpire's call on off stump
looped up on leg stump, think its off the pad as the ball lobs to short leg

thick edge past second slip. Once more, doesn't get to the pitch. This time he's looking to drive through cover

It spins just a touch and takes a thin edge that Dickwella takes easily....oh dear. Rod Tucker is signalling to the dressing room to call Elgar back. He has missed yet another no-ball call. The third umpire has pointed it out. The decision will be overturned. He's two inches in front with his heel. Before the rules were changed earlier this year, a batsman couldn't be called back after walking off the ground. Elgar might be the first one to benefit from that rule.
rips past the outside edge. Length on off stump, spins away sharply
short of a length outside off, punched to point off the back foot
short of a length outside off, jabbed into the covers

inside edge onto pad, looks to drive again, away from the body at this wide length ball

lands wide of short leg who is running back and to his left. De Bruyn steps out and looks to flick but has got an inside edge onto pad that lobs up

spits up from off and Dickwella catches at hip height as Elgar looks to defend on the front foot
into the pads and tickled into the leg side

well done at deep square. Roshen puts in a dive to his right to stop a furious sweep from De Bruyn. Picked up from wide outside off

follows with his hands as this length ball spins away from him. Can't connect

is that dropped? Appears to have been pushed into the square leg region by a leaping leg gully. Before that, De Bruyn appears to have got an inside edge onto pad on the sweep

jumps past the outside edge as he's stuck halfway between forward and back when looking to defend

Dilruwan has his foot behind this time and that man Elgar in his wickets tally. At last.
length on off stump, shuffles on the back foot to defend
length ball down leg side, left alone

legbreak from Akila. He picks it. Length ball turning away from off and he defends with the turn

leading edge as he looks to whip through miidwicket off the back foot with the turn. Closes the face too early. Amla inadvertently parries it towards mid-off as he looks to get back in the crease at the other end
googly that Amla hasn't picked. But it's full enough to not misbehave as he gets forward and defends off the inside half

shot. Gets to the pitch to drive against the turn and squeezes it through cover
inside half as he looks to force another one against the turn. Not even close to the pitch of the ball outside off this time
length ball wide outside off, shuffles to sweep, cops it on the front pad. He's outside the line
beautiful. Authoritative from Amla. Jumps up at the right time, meets this offbreak at the pitch wide outside off and jams it wide of mid-off

lbw appeal turned down as Amla looks to sweep. Sri Lanka will review it. Amla is caught on the pad looking to sweep. He's shuffled a long way first. Has he done enough to get outside the line of off? full on off stump, goes deep in the crease to defend
offbreak pitches on leg and spins down. He can't get bat on the flick and the keeper can't stop cleanly

short of a length on off, tapped into the extra cover region off the back foot

nicely done. Down the pitch to meet this at the pitch and flick to deep midwicket

loopier on off, forward and smothered

full and outside off, laced to the covers
pushed through outside off, Faf drops to one knee and smokes a sweep to midwicket
full and drifts in on middle, defended
full on middle, dead-batted again
uses his feet and pushes a full ball to the covers
short of a length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
full on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
good length outside off, stretches out to sweep to backward square
length on middle stump, dead-bats off the back foot

length ball on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
length ball into the pads, inside edge onto pad and into the leg side
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short an wide outside off. Looks to cut but it spins a long long way away. Past the keeper too and between him and slip
nicely played, albeit a little too early. Sweeps from outside off, and gets a bit of a leading edge on this. Between deep square and deep midwicket
length on off stump, blocked into the covers on the front foot
tossed up wide outside off, driven to point
length ball turning into the pads as he looks to make room to punch through cover
rips back in sharply at middle stump as he looks to make room again. Just gets bat to keep it out
length outside off, sweeps to deep square
length outside off, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
full, curving in towards off, Faf plays for the angle but the ball spins sharply past the outside edge
turn and bounce outside off, Faf is beaten in the corridor again
shorter and wider outside off, forced away to the right of short cover
De Bruyn opens the face and dabs a turning ball to the covers
the batsman shapes for a sweep, adjusts to a straighter one on off, and pokes it out to the covers
fast skidder outside off, leans back and chops hard to backward point

Dananjaya belts out a big appeal for caught behind, umpire Tucker shakes his head. Lakmal calls for a review of the not-out decision. Sharp wrong'un from Dananjaya, spins in from a fuller length, as Faf plays around his front pad and the inside edge lobs off the pad to Mathews at first slip. Ultra Edge detects a spike

back-to-back wrong'uns, Maharaj has been pinned in front this time. Given out by Tucker this time. Maharaj chooses to challenge the decision now. Full and the googly breaks in to catch the front pad as Maharaj has a short stride and plays outside the line of it. Impact in line with off stump. Did Maharaj snick it? Nope, and the tracker returns three reds. Why did Maharaj review if he hadn't edged it?
topspinner on off, stretches out and solidly drives it back to the bowler
offbreak from Akila, spins down leg, Bavuma overbalances as he misses the reverse sweep
tickled with the spin to backward square leg
flat and balloons into the lap of short leg off the thigh pad
full and dips at off, forward and dead-batted
shorter on middle and leg, de Bruyn picks the length early. Goes back and punches the ball through the midwicket region
tossed up and drifts in on middle, Bavuma plays back and pokes it out to point
pushed through flat on middle, rolls his wrists and sweeps it away behind square for four
low full-toss outside off, forward and laced to mid-off
tossed up on leg stump, Bavuma can't deal with extra bounce and top-edges a sweep over backward square leg
fuller and outside off, de Bruyn stretches out and sweeps it with the break to the square leg boundary. Hit flat and hard to the fence
googly, worked behind square off the back foot
short and spins back into a back-foot punch to sweeper
floaty full ball on off, dead-batted away
back of a length on middle, defended to short leg
drags down a legbreak outside off, de Bruyn steps back and crunches it away through the covers. He feels his arm right after hitting that. Sore?
full on middle, defended to the off side
swept from outside off to deep midwicket
drifts in and bursts away outside off as de Bruyn tucks his bat inside the line
flatter and spins away past the outside edge after opening up the batsman
full on middle, presses forward and dead-bats it
full on off, played back to the bowler
sharp turn from outside off, hits the inside edge but Dickwella can't catch it diving forward. Just evades him
swept from outside off to square leg
full on middle, shuffles across and blocks stoutly to the leg side
dangled up on off, dead-batted
shorter and outside off, a back-foot force to the covers ensues
full and straightening down the line on off, blocked out
tossed up on the leg stump, rolls out another sweep and finds the gap between long leg and deep midwicket
drifts in, grips, turns, and bounces as Bavuma plays inside the line and allows himself to get beaten in the channel
full and outside off, jabbed to the covers
pushed through on off, Bavuma stretches out and sweeps flat and hard through square leg
short and wide outside off, chopped to the left of Dilruwan at backward point. Top diving save from the birthday boy
pushed through on off, de Bruyn dead-bats it
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up outside off, gets down for the first sweep of the day. Squeezes it out to deep square
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball turning down leg side, left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
length ball on leg stump, plonks the front leg across and paddles it fine
length on off stump, defended doff the back foot
length on leg stump, gets inside the line again and taps the sweep down to fine leg
full on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
short of a length on off stump, gets on the back foot and turns it to square leg
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
nicely done. Gets down the pitch and is beaten in flight. But manages to keep his shape and flick this on the up through midwicket
raps the pad outside the line of leg stump. This spins back in and takes the inside edge
length ball on middle stump, looks to sweep and cops it on the body
length ball pushed flat on leg stump, defended off the back foot
big turn into the pad, and bounce too. Lobs up to leg slip as he looks to evade
length ball down leg side, left alone
tossed up on off stump, blocked into the off side
length and angled in at off. Gets deep in the crease and defends with a straight bat
beaten. Defends inside the line as this drifts in at off stump and fizzes away
yorker length outside off. Jammed back down the pitch
beats the outside edge again. This time a lot of bounce too as Bavuma pushes forward
and once again. Turning too much to cause trouble. Bavuma happy to defend inside the line for the one that skids on
full and flat outside off. Stabbed into the off side with no feet
length outside leg stump, gets back and flicks to long leg
sweeps aerially past square leg. Not in control against this rising ball, but he manages to get it fine of the fielder
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to long leg off the back foot

short leg lunges forward to take one. Bavuma steps out and looks to flick. It looks like has lobbed off the pad with no other contact...but Sri Lanka have made a late review decision. He looks okay. There's nothing on Ultra Edge. Ball's climbing into his front pad too as he's down the pitch, surely it's turning down leg...it is decision upheld. Sri Lanka lose the review.

length ball ripping in at him again, he steps out clips into midwicket on the up...and a run out attempt from there ends up too strong a throw at the non-striker's end. No one backing up at cover...because no one is at cover.
tossed up on off stump, gets down and gets a vicious sweep out to deep square
length ball dipping and ripping outside off. De Bruyn can't get his bat close as it spins away
once more, sharp turn, steep bounce as he gets forward to defend
short of a length and wide outside off, he lets it go. Herath smiles at the young'un
the arm ball. De Bruyn is alive to the wily old man's variation. Blocks into the leg side with a short stride
nearly steers to slip. Follows this short of a length ball outside off with his hands and jabs aimlessly with an open face. It falls short of Mathews
short of a length outside off, on the back foot to tap into the covers. Dilruwan retrieves the ball himself
nicely played. Gets back in the crease, allows it to slide across him and plays it very late. Punches through the covers and brings up his first fifty in Test cricket
length on off stump, dead-bats with the turn on the front foot
length ball climbs up at his thigh and he allows it after shaping to try and defend
length on leg stump, watches closely and dabs to leg slip off the back foot
length on leg stump, watchfully pushed in leg slip's direction again
length on leg stump, defended down the pitch
length on leg stump, blocked into the leg side
arm ball sliding in rapidly into his pad as he looks to get on the back foot. It's going down leg
full and flat on off stump, blocked into the covers
inside half as he's lulled into this loopy ball on leg stump. Not to the pitch, just manages to close the face and get this out to deep backward square
length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, punched through midwicket off the back foot
loud appeal as short leg takes another loopy one. It's off the pad as he stretches far outside off to try and defend
short of a length on leg stump, whipped expertly behind square
short of a length on leg stump, punched to square leg's left off the back foot
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off's left. Herath tumbles there and can't keep it to a single
length outside off, gets on top of it and sweeps out to deep backward square
defends inside the line as the ball spins steeply away outside off
thick outside edge rolls past the slip. Tossed up at off stump, blocked with soft hands as this spins away
length on off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
past the outside edge. This straightens marginally and nearly takes off stump too. Nice floaty ball on off stump
length on off stump, pushed towards mid-on off the front foot. An electric Herath gets across and prevents the run
length on leg stump, blocked into the leg side
starts with an offbreak. It's short and very wide. Bavuma slaps it to the point boundary with some authority
short of a length and climbing up at off stump, defended off the back foot
googly is picked. Tossed up outside off and he gets a big stride to clip this to deep midwicket
nicely done. Superb. Short from Akila again, spinning in at off stump this time. Gets right back and punches it wide of mid-off while he's still on the move.
length outside off, blocked on the front foot, off the inside half
length ball spinning down leg, past the inside edge as he looks to defend off the back foot. Past the keeper too, and leg slip.
length ball spinning away from the corridor, squares him up as he defends on the back foot
length at the stumps, blocked on the front foot
length on leg, kicked away
short of a length and down leg side. Gets it caught between his knees as he looks to whip off the back foot
length on leg stump, defends down the pitch with soft hands
whack! Square leg and fine leg are both halfway in for Bavuma's top edge, but he's got right to the pitch of this outside leg and bludgeoned it between both of them, all along the floor
length outside off, looks to sweep and is caught on the pad. Long way outside off and they won't review
length outside off, blocked from the crease
length and spinning in at leg stump, pushed into the leg side
short of a length and coming in at middle. Looks to make room again but is cramped quickly. Dangerous shot. Rolls back down the pitch
length ball turning down leg side. Left alone
short and coming in at off stump. Backs away and cuts off the high part of the bat, into the covers
short of a length just outside off, doesn't quite come on. De Bruyn must be excited about pace. Looks to force this through cover but can't time it
length on off stump, blocked solidly off the back foot
length and in at middle stump, punched to mid-on's right. A throw from him at the non-striker's end. It deflects off the stumps for an extra run at extra cover

shot! Oh this is glorious. Length ball outside off, lifts up with the spongy nature of the pitch. But he plans half a stride into the off side and slams this pull over the square leg boundary. Top quality shot on a slow pitch. Too good.
length in the corridor, blocked off the front foot
offcutter at a length, leans in and picks it. Taps it through midwicket with the angle
length on off stump, gets deep in the crease and nudges into the leg side off the back foot
nice take at short leg, diving forward and one-handed. But this has pinged off the pad
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
inside edge as he looks to drive against the turn. Not close to the pitch of the ball and he's lucky this flies past short leg
tossed up outside off, meets it on the full and sweeps to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball outside off. Gets back to try and pull, but it slides from under his bat. Was looking to drag it from a long way out
short of a length at off stump, blocked off the back foot
length outside off, left alone
length outside off, opens the face and guides it to gully
short and into the hips. Clips it to deep square off the back foot
short on off stump, blocked off the back foot
short of a length outside off. Punches to mid-on and catches Dilruwan napping to steal a single
length ball down leg side, left alone
length on middle stump, defended to leg slip off the inside half
full outside off, dead-batted down the pitch
short of a length and down leg side. Whipped to deep backward square off the back foot
tossed up at leg stump, driven straight to mid-on
length ball down leg side, left alone
floated on leg stump, blocked on the front foot

length outside off, backs away and punches to mid-off
full on leg stump, flicks into short leg
length ball wayyyy down leg side and spinning even further. It's a wide

pings off the glove as this acts naughty outside off. He's on the back foot to try and defend, it floats wide of slip

uppish but no one in the infield square on the leg side. Another length ball climbs as he gets on the back foot and whips

full outside off. Stretches forward for the reverse sweep and cops it on the boot
short on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
length on middle stump, dead-batted into the pitch

full outside off, blocked into the leg side
tossed up at off stump, blocked into the leg side
full on leg stump, swept firmly. Square leg dives to his right and stops this but he can't prevent the single that gives Bavuma a fifty. Good, positive knock.
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to extra cover
jumps high and wide outside off from short of a length, taking a lot of the soil with it. Leaves it alone
arm ball on middle stump, defended off the back foot
yorker outside off, slices to point
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
short of a length and lifting in at the hips. Watches closely and dabs, very late, between leg slip and short leg

expertly done. This is full outside off and he's put himself in a hole with the stride across. But in the end, he's got the bat around quickly to short-arm jab this towards the third man boundary. Deep point runs across and puts in the slide, can only manage to parry it into the boundary
length at the stumps, dead-batted into the pitch
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
legbreak, full on leg stump. Blocked down the pitch, with the turn
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
lobbed up wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off, stays deep in the crease and slices to point's right
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off. Steps out and stops immediately as this one dips rapidly. Manages to squeeze it off the outside half
nice bowling. Floated wide outside off. Draws him in and makes him drive away form the body. Thick outside edge to point
short of a length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, blocked off the back foot
just evades slip....oh forgive my excitement, that looked like he had reverse swept onto his boot when in fact it was a bump ball that bounced over Mathews
length on leg stump, top-handed swipe to get it to deep square. That's the 100 for their partnership
short of a length on leg stump, pushed into the turf with soft hands
short of a length and ripping into the body sharply. Cramped as he looks to whip this
length on off stump, pushed uppishly into the off side
short on middle stump, swivels and pulls straight to square leg
tossed up wide outside off, left alone

inside edge as he plays for the turn at off stump. It's a slider from Herath. How many have fallen to this ball?
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

full outside off, blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and chops to deep point's right

length ball on middle stump, swept to deep square

length ball spitting up from a length on leg stump. Raps him on the pad

short on middle stump, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
