length ball pitches on middle, rises above the bat as he looks to sweep, then above leg stump, and then past Dickwella's left forearm
inside edge onto boot and past the keeper's outstretched leg as he looks to sweep from outside off
length on off stump, gets forward and flicks to midwicket
lovely shot. Steps out, meets it at the pitch outside off and bludgeons it between stumps and non-striker. Full control
short of a length on middle, tapped to middle off the back foot
tossed up at leg stump, inside half of the bat as he defends on the front foot
full on off, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
length outside off, pushed into the covers with the turn
length on off stump, dead-batted into the off side
full on off stump, blocked into the covers
tossed up on off stump. Blocked into the leg side
length on middle stump, steps out and pushed down the pitch
short of a length and turning into the pads. Clipped to deep backward square
length on leg stump. Controlled reverse sweep to deep point's left
length on middle, swept neatly to deep backward square
length on middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
short and into the hips. Whipped to deep square's left

but that's the end of the partnership! Herath has had a hard time finding the perfect amount of turn to get the edge. Big spin early in the session today and he beat Bavuma many times on the front foot. But this time, it's on middle and off, and it's sufficient movement away as Bavuma presses forward. Once again, Herath has done it. It's a sharp catch from Dickwella too. A splendid innings from Bavuma ends. South Africa back on the mat again. Such slender margins.
hi, I'm Quinton. Tossed up outside off, front foot planted to the pitch and whippy reverse sweep to find the point boundary
and another. Tossed up outside off, reverse sweep out to deep point
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten down leg side as he looks to play the reverse sweep again. Leg slip is caught off guard, fumbles it
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and in at leg stump. Rapped on the thigh guard as he looks to get on the back foot. Going down
pitches on leg, ends up at slip. That's huge turn and he has no clue as he brings down an angled bat at this
length outside off, stays balanced and punches through cover with the turn
past the outside edge. Short of a length and spinning away as he gets forward
short of a length turning away outside off. Squares him up as he defends off the back foot
arm ball at off stump. Well read. Solidly defended on the front foot
full on off stump, defended past silly point
full on off stump, dead-batted into the pitch
length on off stump, whipped to mid-on off the back foot
length ball down leg side. Looks for the reverse but it's too far away

reviews an lbw decision after Tucker gives him out. De Kock is very deep in the crease as he looks to defend with an angled bat. Turned a long way. Is that going down leg? Sri Lanka only need an umpire's call. This had some bounce on it too...close...but it's umpire's call! QDK is gone and suddenly, it's Sri Lanka's session. Rangana Herath, you absolute legend.
yorker length at off stump, jammed into the pitch
length on leg stump, nudges with the turn to deep backward square
large turn. Too much to get the outside edge of Rabada who is defending in front of off
arm ball slides in at middle. Just manages to get his bat in front of the pad and block this
length and turning away from off. Beaten as he chases on the front foot
short of a length, turning and keeping low as he goes on the back foot. Beaten
short of a length at middle stump, Turns it towards mid-on off the back foot
short of a length on middle, pings off the inside edge as he defends
length and wide outside off. Skids past the outside edge as he looks to defend off the front foot
outside edge falls sort of first slip as he defends inside the line on the front foot
full on off stump, driven back down the pitch
flicked aerially from leg stump. Not sure he's in control, but he's safe. Long-on dives to his left and keeps it to one
length on off stump, blocked from the crease
length ball turning sharply past the outside edge as he gets forward
full on leg stump and a loud appeal for lbw as he looks to jam this into the pitch. Might have got bat on that
length at the stumps, blocked
length on off, pushes into the off side with the turn
legbreak rips in sharply and catches him on the pad in front of leg stump. He didn't pick that
full toss on middle stump. Rabada loves it. Stands tall and slaps it over the non-striker
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and spinning in at the corridor, chopped to mid-off's left off the high part of the bat
length on leg stump, stabs away from the body, but gets it where he wants. Out to deep square
length on middle stump, blocked close to the front pad
good take from Dickwella. Plucks this high, almost chest height, to his left. Rabada looking to drive on the up can't make connection as this turns and climbs
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length ball on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
floated up outside off, thick outside edge as he looks to drive without a big stride. Rolls out to point
length ball skidding in towards off. A risky looking sweep, but well connected. Both with bat and with short leg, who deflects it square
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball outside off, skidding straight on and past the outside edge
full at off stump and a glorious, flowing drive to bisect Herath and mid-off. So coolly done.
tossed up outside off, pushes forward and gets it wide of mid-off using his wrists
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, blocked off the thick inside edge
short of a length, ripping away from off. Left alone
no attempt to get to the pitch as he sways at this length ball outside off. The bat speed of Lara, the feet of McGrath. Beaten on the outside edge
full on leg stump, gets to the pitch and flicks past Herath at mid-on. Nice and easy.
tossed up outside off. Eyes light up as this lands in cover-driving area. But he's gone too hard. Jams it into the turf and it bounces over extra cover. Mid-off cleans up
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

shot of the match contender. My goodness that's gorgeous. Length ball on middle stump. Jumps down languidly, makes the pitch and pulls out the perfect golf swing to send this high, straight over the bowler
full on off, blocked on the front foot
spins past the inside edge and hits him on the back thigh as he presses forward
length on off stump, skids straight on. Watched closely as he defends on the back foot
length ball outside off, looks to get his hands through this drive. It skids on with the angle and trickles past slip off the outside half
beaten. Another skidder from around the wicket. Length and outisde off. Beaten as he looks to defend
short and down leg side. Gets on his back knee and caresses this past leg slip
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
brave leave. And a huge grin. Rabada expects this length ball to turn away as he puts in a picturesque leave. But it's come back with the arm ad perfectly avoided everything on its way to the keeper

is that it? Yes it is! Maiden Test hundred for Theunis de Bruyn and you can bet it's been one of his most challenging knocks ever. Confidently gets down at this length ball on middle and paddles it very fine, keeping his eyes on it, keeping his shape, keeping his wits - everything he's done all innings long. Very impressive.
yorker length, dead-batted
full on off stump, blocks into the pitch
length outside off, rips past the outside edge as he looks to defend

five for Herath! This is mastery. It's the work of a man who has 34 five wicket hauls. He has made South Africa's best batsman look like No. 11. What a ball this is. Pitching on the same spot as the previous one, maybe mariginally fuller. Seam pointed into the off side, but it's an arm ball. De Bruyn is looking to leave, but it's skidded into off stump. Takes the best to get the best. An angry roar from Herath as punches the air. This lion doesn't age.
length on off stump, watchfully defended on the front foot
length on off stump, bat-pad into the off side, along the floor

taken at first slip. The new ball is doing its job and the end is nigh. Length ball turning and climbing away from off. Rabada defends away from the body. Mathews takes an easy one to his left. Straightforward stuff.
length ball skids past the outside edge as he pokes forward outside off
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
pummelled. Length ball outside off, spinning in sharply, so naturally you must hit it to deep midwicket. Swings and connects sweetly with the slog
bring it on, says Steyn. Herath slapped him over the midwicket earlier. He returns the favour by jumping down the track and slicing him into the boundary padding at long-off
too good for Steyn. Rips past the outside edge as he looks to block
length on off stump, dead-batted into the pitch
full on off stump, inside edge onto pad and into the turf. Herath enquires about the lbw, it's turned down by everyone around him

Herath wins the duel, Sri Lanka have the match and the series. Steyn jumps down the track and isn't to the pitch of this length ball. Looks to slog, gets it off the toe-end and it's high, straight over the bowler. Long-on gets under it and takes with a reverse cup
